[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-stdlib/src/natives/mod.rs] [Struct: GasParameters] [Struct padding attacks] Could malicious struct layout or padding in GasParameters be exploited to corrupt adjacent memory or cause alignment issues? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-stdlib/src/natives/mod.rs] [Function: all_natives()] [Iterator safety] Can the iterator returned by make_all() functions be invalidated or corrupted, causing use-after-free when constructing the native function table? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-stdlib/src/natives/mod.rs] [Struct: GasParameters] [Zero gas exploits] Beyond zeros(), can individual gas parameters be set to zero (e.g., only per_byte_serialized=0) to enable selective operation undercharging? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-stdlib/src/natives/mod.rs] [Struct: GasParameters] [Max gas parameter] Can gas parameters be set to MAX values causing integer overflow when multiplied by operation sizes, wrapping to zero or negative gas costs? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-stdlib/src/natives/mod.rs] [Struct: GasParameters] [Legacy parameter abuse] Can legacy parameters (legacy_min_output_size, legacy_min_input_len) be exploited to bypass modern gas metering for newer transaction types? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-stdlib/src/natives/mod.rs] [Struct: GasParameters] [Base cost bypass] Can operations with zero base costs but only per-unit costs be exploited by using zero-sized inputs to get free computation? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-stdlib/src/natives/mod.rs] [Conditional Compilation] [Feature flag bypass] Can the #[cfg(feature = 'testing')] conditional be circumvented through binary patching or linker tricks to enable testing functions in production? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-stdlib/src/natives/mod.rs] [Conditional Compilation] [Feature detection] Is there runtime detection to verify that testing features are disabled, or does the code rely solely on compile-time feature flags? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-stdlib/src/natives/mod.rs] [Macro: add_natives!] [Module name injection] Can module names ('bcs', 'hash', etc.) be crafted with special characters, null bytes, or Unicode to bypass name validation or cause lookup failures? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-stdlib/src/natives/mod.rs] [Macro: add_natives!] [Function name collision] Can two native functions with the same name but different implementations be registered, causing non-deterministic execution across validators? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-stdlib/src/natives/mod.rs] [Function: all_natives()] [Case sensitivity attack] Are module and function names case-sensitive? Can attackers exploit case variations ('BCS' vs 'bcs') to bypass access controls or register malicious functions? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-stdlib/src/natives/mod.rs] [Function: all_natives()] [Registration order determinism] Is the order of native function registration guaranteed to be deterministic across all validator platforms, or could non-determinism cause consensus failures? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-stdlib/src/natives/mod.rs] [Function: all_natives()] [Vec iteration order] Can the Vec<_> construction and iterator behavior differ across Rust versions or platforms, causing different validators to build different native function tables? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-stdlib/src/natives/mod.rs] [Struct: GasParameters] [Floating point gas] Do any gas parameters use floating point arithmetic that could cause non-deterministic rounding across validators? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-stdlib/src/natives/mod.rs] [Function: all_natives()] [HashMap vs BTreeMap] Does make_table_from_iter use deterministic data structures, or could hash randomization cause different validators to have different function lookup behavior? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-stdlib/src/natives/mod.rs] [Function: all_natives()] [Panic on registration failure] If native function registration fails (e.g., duplicate names), does the code panic causing validator crashes, or does it fail gracefully? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-stdlib/src/natives/mod.rs] [Function: make_table_from_iter()] [Error propagation] Are errors during table construction properly propagated, or could silent failures result in missing native functions and transaction execution errors? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-stdlib/src/natives/mod.rs] [Struct: GasParameters] [Validation on construction] Are gas parameters validated to be non-negative and within reasonable bounds, or can invalid values cause undefined behavior? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-stdlib/src/natives/mod.rs] [Function: all_natives()] [VM version compatibility] If the Move VM version changes, could incompatible native function signatures cause type mismatches, crashes, or security vulnerabilities? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-stdlib/src/natives/mod.rs] [Function: all_natives()] [NativeFunctionTable mutation] After construction, can the NativeFunctionTable be mutated to add/remove functions, potentially enabling runtime function override attacks? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-stdlib/src/natives/mod.rs] [Struct: GasParameters] [Gas schedule migration] During protocol upgrades that change gas schedules, can inconsistent gas parameters between old and new validators cause consensus splits? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-stdlib/src/natives/mod.rs] [Function: all_natives()] [Function deprecation] If native functions are deprecated and removed, can old transactions still invoke them, causing undefined behavior or validator crashes? (High)
